openProjects.title: Elo & Flo
openProjects.projectDescription: After secretly taking a pregnancy test, Eloïse asks her girlfriend Florence if she would still love her if she were a boy. Florence is confused and Eloïse explains to her that she might want to cut her hair, which Florence initially welcomes. But she slowly realizes that it's not about the hair, but about the two of them, when Eloïse hints that she wants more than an open relationship. They embrace emotionally, knowing that things are not always as simple as they seem.

openProjects.title: Captive
openProjects.projectDescription: Captive is a thriller short film about a young girl trying to escape the apartment she is held captive in.But ultimately, this film demonstrates the inner struggles of people having to keep their true self locked inside.

openProjects.title: MASHUP PON DI ROAD
openProjects.projectDescription: MASHUP PON DI ROAD is a bashment circus variety show, stopping in outdoor locations across Toronto Summer 2022.Spinning you into an absurd carnival universe where big fun, big laughs, and big Caribbean flavour reign supreme, MASHUP PON DI ROAD is a variety show extravaganza mounted on a 48-foot flatbed truck that rum punches up and speaks truth to power through fast-paced vignettes, original music and nuff jokes.*bashment (n): jamaican vernacular for a really good party; a sweaty dancehall jam

openProjects.title: TRIAGE
openProjects.projectDescription: A young nurse battles her boyfriend to save their ill cat and face a greater fate that awaits them.

openProjects.title: These Are My Reparations
openProjects.projectDescription: These Are My Reparations is a sci-fi, multi-media installation that uses a hybrid of film, sculpture, sound, and online interactive media to tell the story of Honey, a Black woman, who is abducted by a corporate entity built to reproduce sound and visual content for the purposes of social control.

openProjects.title: Hospice
openProjects.projectDescription: Three siblings do their best to care for their mother in hospice, but must face a tough choice when they discover she wants to go through with assisted suicide.

openProjects.title: WiFi
openProjects.projectDescription: In our fear stricken world, where collective anxiety has reached a fever pitch anticipating a global disaster around every corner, it is no surprise that our youth might escape from their responsibilities to a video game. WiFi is about one such adolescent, a teenage mother named Hope, who takes refuge in the wonderland of the internet, an alternative reality with far more allure than her life in a trailer park, and puts her responsibilities on hold as she pursues her dream of broadcasting games.A teenage mother is, after all, a child, and is unprepared for parenthood. Hope reflects this immaturity when she neglects her infant son Austin, who ends up spending most of his time under the supervision of Sara, her guardian. Sara, who is not Hope’s biological parent, treats her as if she is a hopeless burden. This coldness, along with the absence of a natural parent, drives Hope deeper into her home away from home, her streaming channel, where she spends her waking hours playing video games to an audience who shower her with the attention a child might expect from her family.Her rural environment is also unwelcoming, even hostile. Living far from any urban landscape, Hope’s community consists mostly of a few unevenly parked trailers, inhabited by people who are either critical of her situation, or apathetic. The former include a pair of sisters who are sometimes even confrontational, being secretly envious of her. Hope’s step-parent, Gerald, also Sara’s partner, ironically falls more so into the latter category, mostly indifferent to her antics, if not prompted by Sara.These characters are offset by her friends online. They are people she only knows through the internet, and does not even know their real names. They emotionally support her, and even moderate her chatroom, simplifying her life on stream. During these moments, she fails to be a mother to Austin, who is often idle, lonely and even unfed. At other times, Sara even plays the role Hope should be playing, and takes care of Austin.Sara eventually orders for the charade to end. She disconnects the wifi connection just as Hope has been planning a special cosplay stream, where she dresses up in a costume resembling the main character of the videogame, a tactic used by streamers to boost traffic to their channel, which can amount to financial gain.Still hoping to broadcast her cosplay, Hope struggles to reconnect to the internet by ironically reconnecting to her own community. In the process, she also discovers an uncanny connection to her son.

openProjects.title: NAVYN
openProjects.projectDescription: A womanizing photographer learns to find his self worth and quit attaching his identity to meaningless relationships in order to move forward in his career.

openProjects.title: Afuera
openProjects.projectDescription: La oportunidad de ganar fondos para invertir en Ecuador llevará a Andrés, un estudiante ecuatoriano en Alemania, a buscar la ayuda de Vale, su compañera de clase; recreando los mejores momentos en su país de origen para convencerla de regresar a su patria. Sin embargo, las experiencias de Vale fueron muy distintas, y se enfrentará a los recuerdos que la llevaron a salir en un principio.

openProjects.title: A Spirit like no other- Liquor commercial
Becoming Nearly Bearable
openProjects.projectDescription: Becoming Nearly Bearable is a comedic look at societal issues that matter, as seen from inside an Airbnb guest house on the Muskoka River. The main characters encounter the gamut of personalities, annoyances, and life lessons through a revolving door of guest stars whose problems help the main cast find solutions to their own problems. Whether it’s about relationships, health, bigotry, racism, inclusion, important messages are conveyed through comedy.
